tn.text: These are the names of Aaron's sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a shallow metal container which priests used to carry hot coals or incense
"put burning coals in it"

tn.ref: Then they offered unapproved fire before Yahweh, which he had not commanded them to offer
tn.text: "But Yahweh did not approve of their offering because it was not according to what he commanded them to offer"
"unapproved fire to Yahweh"

tn.ref: So fire came out from before Yahweh
tn.text: "So Yahweh sent a fire"
"came out from Yahweh"
The fire completely burning the men up is spoken of as if the fire devoured or completely used them up. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"they died in the presence of Yahweh"

tn.ref: "This is what Yahweh was talking about when he said, 'I will reveal my holiness ... before all the people.'"
tn.text: This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "This is what Yahweh was talking about when he said that he would reveal his holiness ... who come near him, and that he will be glorified ... people." (See:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: I will reveal my holiness to those who come near me
tn.text: The phrase "those who come near me" refers to the priests that serve Yahweh. "I will show those that come near to serve me that I am holy" or "Those who come near to serve me must treat me as holy"

tn.ref: I will be glorified before all the people
tn.text: This second part of Yahweh's statement still concerns the priest, who are the ones who come near to Yahweh. This can be translated in active form. AT: "They must glorify me before all the people" or "They must honor me in the presence of all the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This does not mean they were literal brothers. Here "brothers" means relatives or cousins.
"So Mishael and Elzaphan came near"

tn.ref: carried them, still wearing their priestly tunics
tn.text: carried the bodies of Nadab and Abihu, which still had on the priestly tunics
These are the names of Aaron's sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Do not let your hair on your heads hang loosely, and do not tear your clothes
tn.text: Yahweh is telling Aaron and his sons not to show any outward signs of grief or mourning. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: so that you may not die
tn.text: "so that you will not die"

tn.ref: not be angry with all the assembly
tn.text: Here "assembly" means the whole congregation of Israel, not just a group of leaders. AT: "not be angry with all the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "house" represents the people. AT: "all the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for those whom the fire of Yahweh has set ablaze
tn.text: "for those whom Yahweh killed with his fire"
Here "This" refers back to the command for the priests to not drink wine or strong drink when they enter the tent of meeting.

tn.ref: a permanent statute throughout your people's generations
tn.text: Translate these words the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:15|3:17]].
You can start a new sentence here. "You must do this so that you will be able to distinguish"

tn.ref: between the holy and the common
tn.text: The nominal adjectives "the holy" and "the common" can be stated as adjectives. AT: "between what is holy and what is common" or "between what is dedicated to God and what is ordinary" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: between the unclean and the clean
tn.text: The nominal adjectives "the unclean" and "the clean" can be stated as adjectives. AT: "between what is unclean and what is clean" or "between what God will not accept and what he will accept" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
A person or thing that Yahweh has stated is unfit to touch is spoken of as if they were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
A person or thing that Yahweh has stated is fit to touch is spoken of as if they were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the offerings to Yahweh made by fire
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the burnt offerings to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"for the grain offering is most holy"

tn.ref: this is what I have been commanded to tell you
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "this is what Yahweh commanded me to tell you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The breast that is waved and the thigh that is presented to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "The breast and thigh that a person waved and presented to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
the front part of the animal's body below the neck
the upper part of the leg above the knee
A place that is fit to be used for God's purposes is spoken of as if it were physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: for they are given as your share
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "for Yahweh has given them as your share" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You and your sons and daughters
tn.text: Here "You" refers to Aaron. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: They will be yours and your sons' with you as a share forever
tn.text: Translate this so it is understood that the portion belongs to Aaron and his sons. AT: "This portion will always be for you and your sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be translated in active form. AT: "the priests had burned it all" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate these names as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:10:05|10:6]].

tn.ref: Why have you not eaten ...  before him?
tn.text: Moses uses a question to rebuke Eleazar and Ithamar. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "You should have eaten ... before him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"since the sin offering is most holy"

tn.ref: to take away the iniquity of the assembly
tn.text: Causing Yahweh to forgive the people of Israel is spoken of as if iniquity were an object that Yahweh takes from the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"in his presence"
This can be translated in active form. AT: "you did not bring its blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Aaron is referring to the death of his two sons.

tn.ref: would it have been pleasing in the sight of Yahweh?
tn.text: These sacrifices were to be eaten with joy and happiness. Aaron uses a question to emphasize that Yahweh would not be pleased for him to eat the sacrifices since he is sad because of his sons' deaths. This question may be translated as a statement. AT: "certainly, Yahweh would not have been pleased." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
